summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing the status of a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's property in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands. The email indicates the warrant is under judicial review, with agents planning to travel to execute it once signed.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York office
persons.context: The sender of the initial email providing an update on the search warrant status for an Epstein property in St. Thomas.

events.title: Search Warrant Review for Epstein Property
events.description: A search warrant related to Jeffrey Epstein is being reviewed by a judge in St. Thomas. The judge is in San Juan for training but will return to St. Thomas the next day to potentially sign the warrant.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York office

events.title: Planned Meeting to Sign Search Warrant
events.description: Case agents are scheduled to meet the judge at chambers to sign the search warrant for an Epstein property.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York office

keyFacts: The FBI was actively pursuing a search warrant for a Jeffrey Epstein property in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, in August 2019.
The warrant was under judicial review, with the reviewing judge temporarily in San Juan for training.
FBI agents from the New York office's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad were involved in the operation.
The execution of the search was contingent on the warrant being signed, with travel plans subject to re-evaluation if it was not signed by Sunday morning.
